intro: Adenia craibii, commonly known as the mountain adenia, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of Papua New Guinea. It belongs to the family Passifloraceae and is characterized by its woody stem and large, palmate leaves. The plant produces showy, fragrant flowers with five petals and a distinctive crown of filaments. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in montane rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
